page.title: 01Burrows Farm.
page.content: The assigned block covers an area approximately six miles north-west of Derby and six miles south-east of Ashbourne in the county of Derbyshire. The area traverses the main A52 trunk road between Derby and Buxton.The main centre of population is Brailsford village where about 200 dwellings house approx. 420 adults and 130 children of school age.The fact that these figures are constantly changing reflects the nature of the village. What was once a place of distinct rural character, where the main form of employment was with local landowners,is now more of a commuters haven.This means that families rarely settle in the area for any length of time.Thus,the community life in the village has changed to reflect the needs of these families.
